title: Does Music Make You Run Faster?
subtitle: Runner Adharanand Finn tests whether music can boost running performance.

cards.text: As I lined up at the start with almost 4,000 other runners, a singer sang an inspiring song for us. It may explain why I got off to a good start. I only came eighth in the end, though, even though I’d just spent six months training hard ... However, it turns out that all the training may have affected my response to the music.
cards.question: Which sentence explains why the training influenced his reaction to music?
choices: I was, in fact, taking my running pretty seriously at that time.
I enjoyed that for a few moments, but both of them came and went in a flash.
I need my music all the time.
The music here has been great for my performance.
cards.highlight: I was, in fact, taking my running pretty seriously at that time.

cards.text: The first act passed, a folk group, made me smile, and at one point I found myself running in time to some hard rock ... I can’t say they helped my performance much. But what did other runners make of the music?
cards.question: Which sentence best describes the fleeting nature of the music effect?
choices: I enjoyed that for a few moments, but both of them came and went in a flash.
Someone else, though, may have found it uplifting.
I think they knew why I found the music here so distracting.
I need my music all the time.
cards.highlight: I enjoyed that for a few moments, but both of them came and went in a flash.

cards.text: Adan Bull usually runs marathons with no music and little crowd support. ... ‘With the upbeat bands, you find yourself running to the beat, which helps. It also brings out people to cheer you on.’
cards.question: Which sentence summarizes his positive view of the music?
choices: The music here has been great for my performance.
I need my music all the time.
I enjoyed that for a few moments, but both of them came and went in a flash.
I think they knew why I found the music here so distracting.
cards.highlight: The music here has been great for my performance.

cards.text: The only person I found who was less than happy with the music was Lois Lloyd. ‘There wasn’t enough of it, and I found it wasn’t loud enough, so I ran with an MP3 player,’ she said. ... Karageorghis is not surprised when I tell him.
